context.purpose: AI analyzes its 'Self Analysis Report' to automatically optimize model parameters, inference temperature, prompt design, and evaluation weights, establishing a 'self-evolution loop'.

output.summary: Implemented all core phases for v1.3 Adaptive Optimization: Analyzer Bridge, Optimization Core, Feedback Integration, and Automation & Scheduling. The system can now automatically generate self-analysis reports, parse them to adjust LLM parameters, and schedule these optimizations.

details.Phase 1 - Analyzer Bridge: Modified backend/api/analyze_sessions.py to call modules.self_optimizer.apply_self_optimization() after report generation. Also improved error handling for LLM JSON parsing and added params_updated to API response.
details.Phase 2 - Optimization Core: Implemented logic in modules/self_optimizer.py to parse self-analysis reports, extract average evaluation score, and dynamically adjust model parameters (temperature, top_p) based on score. Optimization results are logged to logs/optimization_log.json. Replaced print statements with logging.
details.Phase 3 - Feedback Integration: Modified modules/llm.py to load dynamic parameters from config/model_params.json and use them in the LLM call payload. Added timestamp and source_model to simulated LLM response.
details.Phase 4 - Automation & Scheduling: Modified orchestrator/scheduler.py to import job_adaptive_optimization and add a new weekly schedule entry for it.

notes: v1.3 Adaptive Optimization phase successfully implemented. The system now has a complete self-evolution loop from analysis to parameter adjustment. Next steps involve frontend integration and further refinement of optimization logic.
